channel.title: Roman Numerals. (Helping People)
channel.description:
[center][b]Roman Numerals[/b][/center] I 1 X 10 XL 40 C 100 II 2 XI 11 IL 49 CIC 199 III 3 XIV 14 L 50 CC 200 IV 4 XV 15 LIX 59 CD 400 V 5 XVI 16 LX 60 D 500 VI 6 XIX 19 LXVIII 68 DC 600 VII 7 XX 20 LXIX 69 CM 900 VIII 8 XXIX 29 XC 90 M 1000 IX 9 XXX 30 IC 99 MCMLXXXIX 1989
The Romans developed a numerical system based on seven letters representing seven numbers:I (1);V (5);X (10):L (50);C (100),D(500) and M (1000).All other numbers are derived by adding letters together(III represents 3)-except where a smaller letter is followed by a larger one,when smaller is subtracted from the larger (IV represents 4).Calculations using Roman numerals where clumsy and difficult-which is why Arabic numerals triumphed.
If there is any questions about Roman numerals,feel free to comment.
Thank you for your time.

item.title: Roman Numerals. (Helping People)
item.dc:creator: @supernovadelta supernovadelta
item.description:
@supernovadelta wrote:

X That is 10000
M 1 million.
That one is short,but X with this - on top is 10000
And M with - that on top is 1 million.

Read full topic

item.title: Roman Numerals. (Helping People)
item.dc:creator: @supernovadelta supernovadelta
item.description:
@supernovadelta wrote:

[center]Roman Numerals[/center]
I 1 X 10 XL 40 C 100
II 2 XI 11 IL 49 CIC 199
III 3 XIV 14 L 50 CC 200
IV 4 XV 15 LIX 59 CD 400
V 5 XVI 16 LX 60 D 500
VI 6 XIX 19 LXVIII 68 DC 600
VII 7 XX 20 LXIX 69 CM 900
VIII 8 XXIX 29 XC 90 M 1000
IX 9 XXX 30 IC 99 MCMLXXXIX 1989

The Romans developed a numerical system based on seven letters representing seven numbers:I (1);V (5);X (10):L (50);C (100),D(500) and M (1000).All other numbers are derived by adding letters together(III represents 3)-except where a smaller letter is followed by a larger one,when smaller is subtracted from the larger (IV represents 4).Calculations using Roman numerals where clumsy and difficult-which is why Arabic numerals triumphed.

If there is any questions about Roman numerals,feel free to comment.

Thank you for your time.

Read full topic
